decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost, then utilize powerful cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with big threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to protect its game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a dominant board presence and outvalue the opponent by leveraging the synergy between ramp, control, and powerful threats.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize Cloudpost ramping to quickly generate a large amount of mana in order to cast powerful spells and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes various control elements such as Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes Karn, the Great Creator to search for key artifacts and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to provide additional removal and card advantage. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and win the game through sheer mana advantage and powerful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudpost and Ancient Tomb to cast powerful spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the opponent's plays. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of big threats and efficient disruption, while generating a significant advantage in mana to maintain dominance throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling powerful artifacts like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. Using cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary to apply pressure, while maintaining control with cards like Force of Will and Tormod's Crypt. The deck leverages the blue color for card draw and manipulation, allowing for efficient resource management and consistent threat deployment. By efficiently utilizing artifacts and strategic plays, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through an aggressive tempo-based approach.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and powerful mana engines to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It includes cards that provide disruption and removal, along with tools like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga to generate additional threats and advantages. The deck is designed to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game, while also having access to powerful spells like Force of Will for protection. By efficiently utilizing artifacts and mana acceleration, the deck aims to put the opponent on the back foot and secure victory through aggressive plays.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and control the game with efficient removal and countermagic spells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, while also deploying threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Quantum Riddler to pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Leyline Binding and Solitude to further control the game and protect its own creatures. Additionally, the deck includes a small land package with cards like Wasteland and Mystic Sanctuary for added utility.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, disruption, and removal spells. It utilizes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters to apply pressure while also having access to counterspells like Force of Will and disruption spells like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and access to important cards. With a mix of removal, disruption, and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue and outsmart the opponent to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent with efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride, supported by disruptive spells like Harsh Mentor and Static Prison. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment provide additional ways to close out the game. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base includes a mix of fetchlands and utility lands like Karakas to ensure consistency and versatility in all matchups.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies combined with Cascade mechanics to overwhelm opponents quickly. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst to cascade into powerful threats like Crashing Footfalls and LÃ³rien Revealed, the deck aims to put pressure on opponents while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The inclusion of disruptive lands like Wasteland and Boseiju, Who Endures helps to control the board and protect key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to enact a fast and overwhelming game plan to secure victory.

The deck revolves around assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, which involves using Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill cards from your library and find Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck also includes tools like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to help dig for combo pieces and protect against disruption. With a mix of countermagic, card filtering, and tutoring from Urza's Saga, the deck aims to quickly and efficiently assemble its combo and win the game.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. It utilizes cards like Narcomoeba and Memory's Journey for resilience, as well as Force of Will for protection. The deck also includes control elements like Swords to Plowshares and Stifle to disrupt opponents, while leveraging cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection. The deck's land base includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Cavern of Souls to support its game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying disruptive threats to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using synergy between creatures and equipment to gain card advantage and tempo advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's board while developing its own game plan, utilizing powerful creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic to control the battlefield. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and utilizing synergies between different creatures and equipment, the deck aims to overpower opponents with its aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on using disruptive spells and creatures to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. It utilizes a combination of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict, to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, it includes powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent to quickly close out the game. The deck also has card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to maintain resources. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly lock down the opponent's mana base using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while playing aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers to quickly end the game. The deck relies on quick, disruptive plays to prevent the opponent from casting spells effectively while building a strong board presence. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures and disruptive elements, ultimately leading to a victory through a mix of damage and control.

The main concept of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command. The deck aims to quickly drop large threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer onto the battlefield, supported by mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith. The deck also utilizes lands like Cavern of Souls and Eye of Ugin to ensure that Eldrazi spells can't be countered and to search for key creatures. The goal is to apply constant pressure and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and control the battlefield with powerful spells like Kozilek's Command. The deck has a strong mana base with cards like Cavern of Souls and Eye of Ugin to ensure consistent casting of Eldrazi creatures. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board dominance and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats, while also running removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is tailored to support the deck's color requirements and includes efficient land destruction with Wasteland. The deck aims to quickly close out games through a combination of early aggression and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and mana generation to create a powerful combo using Mystic Forge. The goal is to rapidly assemble the necessary pieces to generate a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Karn, the Great Creator. By efficiently utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Urza's Workshop, the deck aims to quickly establish control of the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The combination of mana acceleration, artifact synergies, and powerful win conditions makes this deck a force to be reckoned with in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive merfolk creatures while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Opposition and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Force of Will and Hullbreacher, while also generating card advantage through cards like Tishana's Tidebinder. With a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive elements, this merfolk aggro deck is designed to quickly establish board presence and outpace the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This UWx Control deck focuses on using countermagic and removal spells to control the game while utilizing card advantage and selection with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brainstorm. It also includes powerful planeswalkers like Vivi Ornitier and removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with efficient answers and threats, while also having the ability to reset the board with cards like Terminus. It has a strong mana base to support its color requirements and is versatile in dealing with a variety of threats.

The key concept of this deck is to use the cards Tibalt's Trickery, Throes of Chaos, and Creative Technique to quickly and efficiently ramp into big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Maelstrom Wanderer. The deck utilizes a mix of lands that sacrifice for additional resources and lands that produce multiple mana to enable explosive plays. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells while disrupting their game plan with the unpredictability of Tibalt's Trickery.

This Legacy Ninja aggro deck focuses on using low-cost creatures like Ornithopter and Orcish Bowmasters to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes powerful Ninja creatures such as Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator to trigger their abilities and draw cards. With a mix of disruption spells like Fatal Push and Force of Will to control the game, along with hand disruption like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The land base includes fetch lands and Wasteland for consistency and mana disruption.

The deck focuses on using low-cost evasive creatures like Ornithopter and Baleful Strix with strong ninja support from Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator. It also includes disruption spells like Fatal Push, Force of Will, and Force of Negation to control the game. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently with the help of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, Retrofitter Foundry, and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, while also ensuring card advantage through Brainstorm and Ponder. The combination of aggro creatures, ninja synergies, and control elements make the deck a versatile and aggressive force in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck aims to win the game by getting its entire library into the graveyard and then using cards like Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return to win instantly. By utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck can quickly cast spells to achieve its combo. The deck also includes disruption spells like Pact of Negation, Thoughtseize, and Cabal Therapy to protect its combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of fast mana and graveyard manipulation to quickly win the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently play all spells without any lands, utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana. The goal is to quickly mill through the deck with cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, ultimately winning the game by either decking out the opponent or using Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Pact of Negation, Cabal Therapy, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around quickly casting and sacrificing creatures to mill the entire deck, putting key pieces into the graveyard to eventually win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. It utilizes a combination of fast mana sources, free creatures, and disruption spells to ensure a quick and efficient combo execution. The focus is on setting up the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan to ensure a successful win condition.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire deck in one turn. It includes various artifacts and creatures that support this combo, along with cards like Force of Will for protection and Urza's Saga for additional consistency. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur key pieces from the graveyard, while cards like Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and help dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game in a single decisive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana through fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, along with rituals like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual. The deck aims to draw through the library with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key combo pieces like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony. The deck also utilizes Wishclaw Talisman to help tutor for combo pieces or disruption. Overall, the deck is built to efficiently combo off and win the game in one explosive turn.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back to the battlefield using Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also has disruption and protection elements with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, or control the game with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower. The deck's strength lies in its ability to quickly assemble powerful combinations while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using artifact-based prison cards like Trinisphere, Chalice of the Void, and Smokestack to restrict the opponent's options. Karn, the Great Creator can also shut down opposing artifacts while Urza's Saga can generate additional artifacts for value. Archon of Emeria and Timeless Dragon provide additional disruption, while Witch Enchanter and Solitude offer removal options. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and eventually overwhelm them with powerful artifacts and creatures.
